thread.title: There's ANOTHER new suspect in Broadchurch and it'll keep us guessing right to the end
thread.title_full: There's ANOTHER new suspect in Broadchurch and it'll keep us guessing right to the end

author: Ian Hyland
title: There's ANOTHER new suspect in Broadchurch and it'll keep us guessing right to the end
text:
There's ANOTHER new suspect in Broadchurch and it'll keep us guessing right to the end It's episode four and we're still no closer to finding out who the rapist is Share There's another new suspect in Broadchurch (Photo: ITV) Share Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing!   
Yet another new suspect emerged as we reached the half-way point of ITV’s Broadchurch – a convicted rapist who’d recently moved into the area. 
I wouldn’t be too concerned, though, about the fact that he didn’t say what kind of fish he caught during the all-night fishing session he supposedly undertook on the night of the crime. 
Knowing this programme, he almost certainly hooked a basket full of red herrings. Broadchurch is riddled with them. I mean, I know a classic whodunnit is supposed to keep us guessing right up to the end. 
However, it would be nice to think you might have some idea by the end of episode four of an eight part story. 
Unfortunately I have absolutely no reasonable theories. Read More Broadchurch viewers in uproar at David Tennant's character and his shocking tea-making skills Mayford is the latest suspect in the Trish rape case (Photo: Kudos/Imaginary Friends/Sister Pictures/ITV) 
I even found myself eliminating suspects from my inquiries purely on the basis that they did not look shifty enough in the prison visit bibs they were wearing for that football match on the beach. 
I have therefore decided to let Miller and Hardy tackle the major sleuthing. Meanwhile, I will concentrate on some of the more minor mysteries. 
Such as: Did the wardrobe department dress Julie Hesmondhalgh in a Hayley Cropper coat on purpose? Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
